to encourage Laurent Simone Gbagbo to step down from a presidency that isn't his. In November the west African state held elections and despite polls showing Alassane Ouattara Outtara as the victor, Mr. Simone Gbagbo is still in power. In addition to Ivory Coast's neighbors, the UN, US and EU all back Gbabgo's rival Alassane Ouattara Outtara as winner of the west African state's presidential election. Nearly 200 people have been killed in post-election violence with fears that political standoff could tip Ivory Coast back into civil war. Fears of violence have led 14000 people from both political sides to flee the country into neighboring Liberia, and the United Nations estimates total refugees figures may be closer to 30000.
